B. KEMAL PASHA, J.
Dated this the 7‚Äù day of December, 2017
ORDER

Petitioner is the accused in Crime No.594 of 2015 of
Chandera Police Station, which is now pending as C.C.No.2690
of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I,
Hosdurg, registered for the offences punishable under Sections
341, 323 and 324 r/w Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled
between the parties.

3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the
case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled.

4. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents
have been reported against the petitioner. The second
respondent has filed Annexure-A3 affidavit affirming that the
matter has been amicably settled between him and the
petitioner and he has no complaints against the petitioner.
Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled

pea
2017/KER/49567
Cril.M.C. No.8159 of 2017
-~2-

amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no
purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the

case. Matters being so, all further proceedings in C.C.No.2690

of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Hosdurg

in Crime No.594 of 2015 of Chandera Police Station, against

the petitioner, are liable to be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further
proceedings in C.C.No.2690 of 2015 of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate's Court-I, Hosdurg in Crime No.594 of 2015 of
Chandera Police Station, against the petitioner, are hereby
quashed.

Sd/-
B.KEMAL PASHA
JUDGE
Scl/07.12.2017
